utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.sentences: Well, it was -- as a 12-year-old, I was at school.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Were you a fat kid?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: No. Thank you though, because that would have been very relevant to my experience what 9/11 was like for me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And so, it was weird that nobody would like tell us what happened. Like all -- nobody would tell us, we were in a school. We didn't have like T.V.s in the school or anything like that. We didn't have like Internet phones or anything like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What are you, Amish?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: St. Mary Catholic School in Mount Clemens.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: You got it on.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes. I tried to wait until I got home. And you know, it's just watching the T.V. and I -- it's the first time I remember, you know, asking my parents about stuff that they didn't really have the answers to, because they were just as shocked and confused as I was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, yes. It was when the adults were powerless.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. All right. Last word, Tyrus. I'm kind of curious what you were doing 20 years ago, but I want to know what you're thinking now.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm thinking that I'm glad he hates you a little more than me. So, that's a getaway time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: You know, I was in Lewisville, Texas with my dear friend Martin (INAUDIBLE), who's not with us anymore. We're just coming off of arena football. And I just got assigned my first agent, I had a tryout with the Dallas Cowboys. And I was trying to figure out with Cowboys, the bills. When I had Toronto deals, I had all these real important things. So, I -- we went to the club that night that we partied, get up in the morning, and we see the planes go in the building, and we thought it was a T.V. show, I kept switching thes. Still didn't -- still didn't resonate like what just happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: And then for me, although I didn't go into acting then, but it was at that moment that I realized that like, my priorities in life are completely -- because I'm most important thing in the world right now. utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: So, for me, it really caused me to grow up a little more mentally, and see what we could do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Did you want to say something, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERIO

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Freedom looks dour as Biden grabs more power. Yes, another flip flop from the vaccine cop, saying he wouldn't mandate is this latest lie to date. In a move that puts the (INAUDIBLE) dictator, Joe Biden is mandating that private companies with more than 100 workers ensure employees are vaccinated or tested weekly, or he's shutting them down like Kat's liver after a three-day weekend. Biden's royal decree also covers health care workers and federal contractors, impacting as many as 100 million Americans, or as Joe believes half the number of votes he got. But not illegal immigrants pouring through the southern border because the science says they're naturally immune and can transmit it. It has experts asking, why don't people trust the experts. And remember, the virus only spreads at group events if there are American flags. Meanwhile, as Republican governors are vowing to fight this mandate, tooth, and nail, it's hard to ignore the Biden administration's flip-flopping like a fish on the deck of John Kerry's yacht.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you think the COVID vaccine should be mandatory?

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: No, I don't think it should be mandatory. I wouldn't demand to be mandatory.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Is that a sign that perhaps the federal government should step in and issue mandates?

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: That's not the role of the federal government. That is the role that institutions, private sector entities, and others may take.

utterances.speaker: DR. ANTHONY FAUCI, CHIEF MEDICAL ADVISOR TO PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I don't think you'll ever see a mandating of vaccine, particularly for the general public.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, it's like my grandpa once said: fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, and you'll sleep with the fishes, which explains why the pond out back smelled so bad. Tyrus, here is my theory. You're going to like this theory. Biden wants us, Americans, to blame the unvaxxed for this authoritarian shift of government rather than the government itself. He's like saying, no, it's not us. Go after your fellow Americans. They're the ones that are forcing me to become a dictator. So, you can't go to him and go, what are you doing? You said Trump was a dictator. But look what you're doing. It's not me. It's them. The 80 million unwashed rubes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Now, I give it a six.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Out of six?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Oh, I think he's pretty (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: No, out of 45. No, no, no. I get your point, but you're missing the bigger thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.sentences: You're right, in a sense, but it's about the administration's failures. So, they got to blame it on the Trumpers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: They got to blame it on the right. And their whole messages -- to begin with, because they want to say it's presidents Trump's base that's not getting vaccinated. So, of course, it's the bad guys. But you just did an interview.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Where he very passionately talked about being vaccinated and how important it is, in a very polite way which we talked about before.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.sentences: This is the one thing that was supposed to make them great was handling this situation. You had great ideas but we just didn't fall in place. So, yes, it's the unvaccinated they're making the mistakes because he cannot own how horrible his administration handle. What was a gift?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: They had the vaccines, they had it quickly. They had things going on. They had celebrities, everyone's doing their thing. Even the bar -- our friend from the bar rescue is doing the shot. Everyone in this room is vaccinated. So, they've lost it. And of course, they got to blame it on the unvaccinated. And if -- and so, it's really the worst of the worst you could ever see from government.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He might be the -- he might be going down as the most unpopular president after this. Just-- but that, who knows? It's still only eight months. Kat, you're a libertarian.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I sure I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This has to make your or what's left of your blood boil. Can you boil alcohol?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) really quickly too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Anyway, what's left if your blood alcohol mix?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: The fun with my -- the jokes about alleged substance abuse -- talk now?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Proceed.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: OK, all right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's not fair. And I am going to actually talk about substance abuse a little more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: They said government really, it's just crazy how much control they have over like, needles.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Like, if you inject yourself, like with heroin, you can go to jail. But if you don't inject yourself with this thing, you can't have a job?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I don't - you know, we'd like the founding fathers were saying, you know, all the powers are in the Constitution. You can't -- the government can have them. I don't think needles are mentioned anywhere.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And yet, they have complete control. I don't understand how this is legal. It's deeply upsetting. I am vaccinated. As Tyrus said, everyone here is. But I don't see how if I don't own my body, and certainly what I do and do not want to be stabbed into it, that we can't even say that we live in a free country. I think that's pretty basic stuff that your body is your own.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana, did we just -- Some wild applause for the junkie. I'm kidding. She's just --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I'm doing intravenous drugs now. Amazing, I can hold down a job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's incredible. You're like our very own Hunter Biden?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Are we losing more of our rights? Or is this an -- is this -- is this a legitimate emergency action to save our lives?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, it's really interesting that one of the things he said is that if you are an employer that has over 100 employees, they must be vaxxed. But apparently, employers with 99 employees are not that important?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I understand what they're trying to do, to trying to make an impact on the bigger picture. It is actually pretty interesting to look at how some people like -- and businesses are saying, thank goodness, that the government's going to mandate it because now I'm not the bad guy anymore.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Exactly, and you can't sue the bit -- like, if I can't sue by company that I work at, because companies say I'm doing what the government tells me. It's -- they're providing cover.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And he's also concerned about the economy, he can see what's happening, right? Because COVID was supposed to get better, the economy was supposed to be great, and then they're going to add $3.5 trillion with the spending. But if the economy's not doing well, the rest of the agenda will also fall apart. So, he does want people to complain. I'm going to -- I'm cynical in one other point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do you know who this helps -- his speech helped a lot yesterday?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who? "

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Gavin Newsom. Because the people of California, they wanted this. The Democrats wanted this. And they are -- I telling you that, in some ways, I think that this was timed to help Gavin Newsom because I truly believe that speech was not urgent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He did not need to give it right before the 9/11 anniversary. But he did want to give it before the California recall next Tuesday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow. Terry, I seem to remember that Donald Trump was the liar and the authoritarian.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And now what we're seeing is President Biden is the liar because he lied about this, and he's --

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: I think right now he's tracking right now. Biden has already two -- no more, no, read my lips, no new taxes state event.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: This, because he said he wasn't going to do this. And also Afghanistan, we'll leave nobody behind Afghanistan. So, already twice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Those are big ones. Here is a quick thing about a COVID. This -- why people not more mad at China? And here is what I don't get. This gain- of-function thing, we actually make a virus more deadly and contagious. Maybe there's a good reason to do that research. Explain that to me, because that's what they were doing, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: There might be a (INAUDIBLE), maybe you're trying to stop a pandemic, maybe you're not working on bioweapons, I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: That part I get. But what Fauci doesn't -- what I have not been explained to me is, why would you do that research in China? Like, are you really going to -- what kind of judgment do you have as a scientist where you can actually do deadly virus research in China and expect that Chinese scientists to not be controlled by the Chinese government and the military? Like, that's really dumb. That was so bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: And now we -- now, we're never talking about this, and now we're dealing with this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And now -- and that ruins your acting career too.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Yes, it did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, we got to go on. Up next, it's hard to keep it brief with the ex-commander in chief.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: And now, "THE MEETING OF THE MINDS: PART FIVE."

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Behold the final chapter of my glorious interview with former President Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How about the Wuhan lab. You were, you're right, you're ahead of the game on that one.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: I was right about hydroxychloroquine, remember that? Now, had I said do not use under any circumstances.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Everybody would do it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: My mistake with the wall. So, it took me two and a half years to start building because I had lawsuits, I had 11 lawsuits.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Mostly by Congress. Nancy Pelosi and the group crazy Nancy, so mostly by Congress, took me two and a half years to get served. You weren't allowed to start. You had all sorts of restraining. I want all of them. I start building the wall. I mean, think of it. They go out and they say walls don't work. And I always say the only two things that work and they always will, or the wheel and the wall. That wall had such an impact. But we've done a great job. And I think we're given a lot of credit for it. And I think frankly now, we're given much more credit than I was when I was there because they see how bad it's been. We had secured borders. You know, one of the things we talked about the People coming in: well, they couldn't come in very easily. But and the home -- I mean, all the different rules regulations that made it but one of the things I stopped is fentanyl to a large extent, right. I had it down at 81 percent. That's a tremendous challenge.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was, that was incredible.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Now, it's tripled, quadruple what it ever was, and it is the worst drug of all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes. And they're finding it everywhere. Used to just be in street drug, now it's in cocaine, you know, I've changed my lifestyle.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: It's everywhere. You can no longer take anything --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. I'm really, really careful.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You can't have a hamburger. You can't have a hamburger anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. Exactly. You know, to your point. Fake News is one of the most important phrases of this generation.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I think so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because people, generally people complained about bias when they were in their home watching T.V. But it was the first time somebody on TV was saying it to them saying this is fake.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Nobody ever --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: So -- yes, so, I've been out of the perfect tee-up. So, I've been out for 4-1/2 years. I got out from active duty. I didn't almost nine, I went to classical theatre school, Circle in the Square, as a working actor in Manhattan, and we got attacked. So, I thought -- what do I do next? So, I re-enlisted in the National Guard Green Berets and that was October 2001. And I retired in October 2016. So, that's what I did. And I remember thinking to myself, OK, we're at war, what do I do? I'm not telling people that that's what you have to do. That's what -- that's the right decision for me. Cratered my career in one way, but also open up other opportunities. And I remember after I got back from the first deployment after 9/11, my mom and -- my mom said to me, she goes, I haven't seen you looked as happy in a long time. And I go, well, I'm around the guys I love. And so that's what I did. I actually not interested. I've never been interested hearing how people felt during 9/11. I don't really care what you were doing when it happened. What did you freaking do afterwards? How did you change yourself? Did you - - did you get smarter? Were you kinder? Did you stop voting for people who are working for your demise? You know, did you pay attention? And I think a lot of people right off the bat, they did, but then they sort of stopped. And I want to say something else too about the young people. We just saw a clip of really, really not very smart, and soft shell crab human beings. There's a whole another side of our country that's not that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: It is the young -- the young studs that I saw coming in, that would put on their body armor, and go down the road, knowing that we're going to get hit. These 19-year-old kids. And when we just lost the 13 recently, everybody was like, oh, they're so young.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's Right?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Who did you think we're fighting your wars?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Did you think it was Joe Biden or Bernie Sanders or even Donald Trump? No, it's young people. It's young people doing it. And so, hard times make hard men, hard men make good times, good times, make soft men, and we are now in the stage of soft men make hard times. So, that's what's coming.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, that's amazing. But I think -- I think the take-home message here, and the real tragedy --

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Here comes the insult.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I'm going to tell you, real tragedy is that 9/11 killed Terry's acting career. Think about -- Dana, think of all the movies we missed without --

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: No, he was a stage actor.

utterances.speaker: GIUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I really feel it was a mercy killing -- it was mercy killing.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: First of all --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: He's on T.V. now.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I love you, hate you, not a fan of you anymore. And you, I got nothing to say. Terrible people, but Dana's the best. Shame on you. Fair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, Dana, like me, you're a hero.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Would -- I mean, your life change because you ended up coming to D.C., correct?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, my life is -- yes. As I look back on this day, it's been a lot of reflections this week. And I think that the fact that we are remembering and commemorating this day, this 20 years, it feels like it's a milestone. And it is something where you have some people like I've read in the paper that like, we just got to move on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We don't need to have these memorials. And then I've been watching some of the documentaries that have been done. And I'm like, look at what the people went through.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And imagine is the suggesting that the United States no longer need just -- needs to teach what happened at Pearl Harbor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Or what happened to Martin Luther King, Jr. Or what happened to JFK, or what happened to George Floyd?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mean, would anybody suggest that you shouldn't do that. But this one, this one, they wanted to let go because they don't want to think America is exceptional anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or that America is a -- like America, it's the victim here. They don't want to hear that either, because we're the bad guy. All those other -- all those other things you mentioned, you could argue, is America's fault. Right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Absolutely, you could. And they do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I think that Condi Rice has a piece in The Wall Street Journal in which she says, if we don't continue to do this. If we don't live up to never forget, we are doomed to repeat it, which is not as eloquent a way of saying what Terry ended with. Because --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But he's an actor, so.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I -- I'd like to say that it is really interesting to think about all those young people that we saw on the video. I could watch that all day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But you think about the young people that died outside of the Kabul airport. And they were signing up to serve their country in order to make sure that they could say whatever they wanted.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. And I don't even -- I don't -- I don't want to bang on these kids too much, because, you know, they're walking down the street. And they're not thinking.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes, right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That stuff like -- all man on the street stuff is like --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Almost kind of like, these people are not prepared. If you ask me anything on the street, there's a 50 percent chance I am on, on a substance. And whatever comes out of my mouth is going to -- just be --

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: You with gum.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes. No, I'll be brilliant.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'll be brilliant.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes, sorry, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Much like your acting career.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: So, let's see what's going to be on the rest of the night now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, no, you know that you gave me the one line --

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That I'm going to beat to the ground.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: You chose --

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Thank you for your service.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: You chose --

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: And by the way, Gutfeld, you're welcome for your freedom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: To mock me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Listen, you chose not to wear leather pants. You did this to yourself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If you'd worn leather pants, I would have been much nicer.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Oh, I'm sure you would have backed off.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Or a chaps or with something, but --

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I hate all of them. I hate all of them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, no chaps here.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat, Kat, would you -- in September 11th, 2001, you were 36.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat, actually, you were -- what are you? 11 or 12?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I was 12.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, OK. As a -- as a 12-year-old, what was that like?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Well, it was -- as a 12-year-old, I was at school.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Were you a fat kid?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: No. Thank you though, because that would have been very relevant to my experience what 9/11 was like for me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And so, it was weird that nobody would like tell us what happened. Like all -- nobody would tell us, we were in a school. We didn't have like T.V.s in the school or anything like that. We didn't have like Internet phones or anything like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are you, Amish?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: St. Mary Catholic School in Mount Clemens.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: You got it on.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes. I tried to wait until I got home. And you know, it's just watching the T.V. and I -- it's the first time I remember, you know, asking my parents about stuff that they didn't really have the answers to, because they were just as shocked and confused as I was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right, yes. It was when the adults were powerless.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right. Last word, Tyrus. I'm kind of curious what you were doing 20 years ago, but I want to know what you're thinking now.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm thinking that I'm glad he hates you a little more than me. So, that's a getaway time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: You know, I was in Lewisville, Texas with my dear friend Martin (INAUDIBLE), who's not with us anymore. We're just coming off of arena football. And I just got assigned my first agent, I had a tryout with the Dallas Cowboys. And I was trying to figure out with Cowboys, the bills. When I had Toronto deals, I had all these real important things. So, I -- we went to the club that night that we partied, get up in the morning, and we see the planes go in the building, and we thought it was a T.V. show, I kept switching thes. Still didn't -- still didn't resonate like what just happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: And then for me, although I didn't go into acting then, but it was at that moment that I realized that like, my priorities in life are completely -- because I'm most important thing in the world right now. And I -- because I care about was my sports, and seeing what was going on. That's when I started getting into looking into politics and looking for things.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: So, for me, it really caused me to grow up a little more mentally, and see what we could do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: You know, as we were helping getting supplies and then we want to go down there, but they started stopping people, because so many people volunteered to go to New York and dig up stuff. And we were willing to -- the guys were working and training, we were big strong guys, like, hey, we can go help. And we're being stifled when we found things to send supplies down there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Did you want to say something, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I was going to say for those very young people today, the one thing they didn't get to experience on 9/11 that we did. Was everyone coming together?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERIO
utterances.utterance: And that feeling, and that ability, and I think that we all kind of missed that. We long for it. And we keep thinking something's going to happen to bring us back to that moment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Should have been COVID.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It could have been.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, which we're going to talk about in the next block. Still ahead, the grand finale of my epic Donald Trump interview. And up next, Biden says Biden, Biden, what -- do you -- can you read that? I don't even know what that says.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Biden says he does vaccine order but not that he jumped this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He (INAUDIBLE) in a tease. All right, we're going to talk about vaccines.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: "HOLY CRAP: WHAT THE HELL IS NEXT?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Freedom looks dour as Biden grabs more power. Yes, another flip flop from the vaccine cop, saying he wouldn't mandate is this latest lie to date. In a move that puts the (INAUDIBLE) dictator, Joe Biden is mandating that private companies with more than 100 workers ensure employees are vaccinated or tested weekly, or he's shutting them down like Kat's liver after a three-day weekend. Biden's royal decree also covers health care workers and federal contractors, impacting as many as 100 million Americans, or as Joe believes half the number of votes he got. But not illegal immigrants pouring through the southern border because the science says they're naturally immune and can transmit it. It has experts asking, why don't people trust the experts. And remember, the virus only spreads at group events if there are American flags. Meanwhile, as Republican governors are vowing to fight this mandate, tooth, and nail, it's hard to ignore the Biden administration's flip-flopping like a fish on the deck of John Kerry's yacht.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Do you think the COVID vaccine should be mandatory?

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: No, I don't think it should be mandatory. I wouldn't demand to be mandatory.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Is that a sign that perhaps the federal government should step in and issue mandates?

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: That's not the role of the federal government. That is the role that institutions, private sector entities, and others may take.

utterances.speaker: DR. ANTHONY FAUCI, CHIEF MEDICAL ADVISOR TO PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN
utterances.utterance: I don't think you'll ever see a mandating of vaccine, particularly for the general public.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, it's like my grandpa once said: fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, and you'll sleep with the fishes, which explains why the pond out back smelled so bad. Tyrus, here is my theory. You're going to like this theory. Biden wants us, Americans, to blame the unvaxxed for this authoritarian shift of government rather than the government itself. He's like saying, no, it's not us. Go after your fellow Americans. They're the ones that are forcing me to become a dictator. So, you can't go to him and go, what are you doing? You said Trump was a dictator. But look what you're doing. It's not me. It's them. The 80 million unwashed rubes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Now, I give it a six.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Out of six?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Oh, I think he's pretty (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: No, out of 45. No, no, no. I get your point, but you're missing the bigger thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: You're right, in a sense, but it's about the administration's failures. So, they got to blame it on the Trumpers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: They got to blame it on the right. And their whole messages -- to begin with, because they want to say it's presidents Trump's base that's not getting vaccinated. So, of course, it's the bad guys. But you just did an interview.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Where he very passionately talked about being vaccinated and how important it is, in a very polite way which we talked about before.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: This is the one thing that was supposed to make them great was handling this situation. And when you don't hire the best and brightest, when you hire somebody by the way they look, and the content of their skin and not their resume, this is what happens. You had great ideas but we just didn't fall in place. So, yes, it's the unvaccinated they're making the mistakes because he cannot own how horrible his administration handle. What was a gift?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: They had the vaccines, they had it quickly. They had things going on. They had celebrities, everyone's doing their thing. Even the bar -- our friend from the bar rescue is doing the shot. Everyone in this room is vaccinated. So, they've lost it. And of course, they got to blame it on the unvaccinated. And if -- and so, it's really the worst of the worst you could ever see from government.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He might be the -- he might be going down as the most unpopular president after this. Just-- but that, who knows? It's still only eight months. Kat, you're a libertarian.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I sure I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This has to make your or what's left of your blood boil. Can you boil alcohol?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE) really quickly too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Anyway, what's left if your blood alcohol mix?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: The fun with my -- the jokes about alleged substance abuse -- talk now?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Proceed.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: OK, all right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's not fair. And I am going to actually talk about substance abuse a little more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: They said government really, it's just crazy how much control they have over like, needles.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Like, if you inject yourself, like with heroin, you can go to jail. But if you don't inject yourself with this thing, you can't have a job?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I don't - you know, we'd like the founding fathers were saying, you know, all the powers are in the Constitution. You can't -- the government can have them. I don't think needles are mentioned anywhere.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And yet, they have complete control. I don't understand how this is legal. It's deeply upsetting. I am vaccinated. As Tyrus said, everyone here is. But I don't see how if I don't own my body, and certainly what I do and do not want to be stabbed into it, that we can't even say that we live in a free country. I think that's pretty basic stuff that your body is your own.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana, did we just -- Some wild applause for the junkie. I'm kidding. She's just --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I'm doing intravenous drugs now. Amazing, I can hold down a job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's incredible. You're like our very own Hunter Biden?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are we losing more of our rights? Or is this an -- is this -- is this a legitimate emergency action to save our lives?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, it's really interesting that one of the things he said is that if you are an employer that has over 100 employees, they must be vaxxed. But apparently, employers with 99 employees are not that important?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I understand what they're trying to do, to trying to make an impact on the bigger picture. It is actually pretty interesting to look at how some people like -- and businesses are saying, thank goodness, that the government's going to mandate it because now I'm not the bad guy anymore.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Exactly, and you can't sue the bit -- like, if I can't sue by company that I work at, because companies say I'm doing what the government tells me. It's -- they're providing cover.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And he's also concerned about the economy, he can see what's happening, right? Because COVID was supposed to get better, the economy was supposed to be great, and then they're going to add $3.5 trillion with the spending. But if the economy's not doing well, the rest of the agenda will also fall apart. So, he does want people to complain. I'm going to -- I'm cynical in one other point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do you know who this helps -- his speech helped a lot yesterday?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who? "

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Gavin Newsom. Because the people of California, they wanted this. The Democrats wanted this. And they are -- I telling you that, in some ways, I think that this was timed to help Gavin Newsom because I truly believe that speech was not urgent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He did not need to give it right before the 9/11 anniversary. But he did want to give it before the California recall next Tuesday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow. Terry, I seem to remember that Donald Trump was the liar and the authoritarian.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE) too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. And now what we're seeing is President Biden is the liar because he lied about this, and he's --

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I think right now he's tracking right now. Biden has already two -- no more, no, read my lips, no new taxes state event.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: This, because he said he wasn't going to do this. And also Afghanistan, we'll leave nobody behind Afghanistan. So, already twice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Those are big ones. Here is a quick thing about a COVID. This -- why people not more mad at China? And here is what I don't get. This gain- of-function thing, we actually make a virus more deadly and contagious. Maybe there's a good reason to do that research. Explain that to me, because that's what they were doing, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: There might be a (INAUDIBLE), maybe you're trying to stop a pandemic, maybe you're not working on bioweapons, I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: That part I get. But what Fauci doesn't -- what I have not been explained to me is, why would you do that research in China? Like, are you really going to -- what kind of judgment do you have as a scientist where you can actually do deadly virus research in China and expect that Chinese scientists to not be controlled by the Chinese government and the military? Like, that's really dumb. That was so bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: And now we -- now, we're never talking about this, and now we're dealing with this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And now -- and that ruins your acting career too.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes, it did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, we got to go on. Up next, it's hard to keep it brief with the ex-commander in chief.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: And now, "THE MEETING OF THE MINDS: PART FIVE."

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Behold the final chapter of my glorious interview with former President Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How about the Wuhan lab. You were, you're right, you're ahead of the game on that one.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: I was right about hydroxychloroquine, remember that? Now, had I said do not use under any circumstances.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Everybody would do it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: My mistake with the wall. So, it took me two and a half years to start building because I had lawsuits, I had 11 lawsuits.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Mostly by Congress. Nancy Pelosi and the group crazy Nancy, so mostly by Congress, took me two and a half years to get served. You weren't allowed to start.
